description:
Role: Supply Chain Analyst II

Start Date: January 2023

Duration: 6 Months

Location: NorthRidge, CA

About The Role

You will be responsible for the planning and movement of finished goods within the distribution network in order to satisfy demand while balancing cost.

Your Team

You will report to the Supply Chain Director.

What You Will Do

  • Evaluate inventory coverage with the distribution network and redirect shipments as necessary
  • Build STOs and/or Intercompany POs to balance inventory across the network
  • Monitor and propose transportation mode options to expedite critical inbound shipments
  • Coordinate scheduling with internal transportation/warehouse teams and external forwarder/3PL partners

What You Need

  • Bachelor's degree in Supply/Operations or related discipline preferred
  • 1-3 years experience in Supply Planning, Inventory Management, Material Master Data Management preferably in a fast paced consumer industry
  • High-level proficiency with MS Excel
  • Experience with SAP ERP / IBP highly preferred

What Makes You Eligible

  • Must provide full work availability from January 1, 2023 through June 30, 2023 and be able to work 40 hours per week

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.
